fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Clicking the _Create_ button, Jira will open the Create Issue screen where the user will provide the issue information.

The default Description field is a [_Wiki style renderer_|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-renderers-938847270.html] and provides a toolbar with many options to edit the text in it.

One of the options in that toolbar is an icon to add Attachments to the new issue and to refer to it in the description text.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

When clicking on the _Create_ button from a Dashboard, the _Description_ filed has the _Attachment_ button missing.
It is still possible to add attachments to the new issue using the _Attachment_ field and referring to the file using wiki markup in the _Description_, but that could be cumbersome to most users.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

This misbehavior was only introduced on Jira version 8.14.0 onward and affects all three Jira editions, namely Core, Software and Service Management (version 4.14.0).
Previous versions, such as 8.5.X and 8.13.X LTS releases are *not* affected by this bug.

When accessing an issue and only then clicking on the _Create_ issue button, then the _Attachment_ button is properly shown in the toolbar of the _Description_ field.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a vanilla Jira Core instance on version *8.14.0*.
  #* This was validated on version *8.15.0* as well.
 # Create a project with sample data.
 # Access one of the existing issues and click on the _Create_ button.
 # Note the _Attachment_ button appears in the _Description_ toolbar.
 # Access the _System Dashboard_ by clicking on the Jira logo.
 # Click on the _Create_ button.

h3. Expected Results
The _Attachment_ button appears in the _Description_ field toolbar.

h3. Actual Results
The _Attachment_ button is missing in the _Description_ field toolbar.

Checking the CSS style for the _Attachment_ button, the {{display: inline block;}} option is overwritten by other CSS scripts, making it to be hidden.
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
An user could have the following options:
# Creating an issue from the _Issue View_ doesn't trigger this problem.
# Adding files through the _Attachment_ field still works.
fields.summary: Creating an issue from the dashboard won't show the attachment button in the Description field

fields.description:
At present (_Jira 8.5.x, Jira 8.13.x_), installation of the Jira Issue Collector on to a webpage will render the following default message when form is submitted successfully:

{panel}Thank you for your feedback!

Thanks for providing your feedback! This window will automatically close in 5 seconds.{panel}

It would be ideal if this message could instead include the Issue ID for the Issue that was just created, so the user is immediately aware of an ID they can track.
fields.summary: Add Issue ID to form response for Jira Issue Collector

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Reindexing process breaks with _IllegalStateException_ due to registered multiple {{NonNullCustomFieldProvider}} for the same CustomField (this is a separate problem). This breaks the logic in the 
{{DefaultIssueDocumentFactory}} which expects only a single result, which causes the mentioned Exception. 
From the high level, the problem area looks like this:
* Multiple providers got created during plugin restart due to a problem with deregistering logic (_removeUnavailableProviders_ has a mechanism for removing stale providers.)
* New CustomFieldProvider code doesn't handle duplicates (current bug)
 
For example, reindex will fail after disabling and enabling of the Jira Agile Plugin. The same behaviour also reported after the upgrade of the UPM, since it will restart all dependant plugins (see JRASERVER-69963) 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
One of the ways to trigger the problem:
 # Disable Jira Agile plugin.
 # Enable Jira Agile plugin.
 # Reindex a single issue.

h3. Expected Results

Reindex should finish without any errors
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
/secure/admin/IndexReIndex!reindex.jspa [c.a.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder] java.lang.IllegalStateException: Duplicate keys mapped to com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.vdi.CustomFieldPrefetchedData@22069d65 / com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.vdi.CustomFieldPrefetchedData@6a887793 for custom field id customfield_10001
 java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Duplicate keys mapped to com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.vdi.CustomFieldPrefetchedData@22069d65 / com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.vdi.CustomFieldPrefetchedData@6a887793 for custom field id customfield_10001
     at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndex$Failure.<init>(DefaultIndex.java:100)
     at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer$EntityOperation.lambda$perform$6(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:858)
     at java.util.HashMap.forEach(HashMap.java:1289)
     at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer$EntityOperation.perform(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:858)
     at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer.lambda$processBatch$2(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:334)
     at com.atlassian.jira.index.SimpleIndexingStrategy.apply(SimpleIndexingStrategy.java:7)
     at com.atlassian.jira.index.SimpleIndexingStrategy.apply(SimpleIndexingStrategy.java:5)
     at com.atlassian.jira.index.MultiThreadedIndexingStrategy$1.call(MultiThreadedIndexingStrategy.java:47)
     at com.atlassian.jira.index.MultiThreadedIndexingStrategy$1.call(MultiThreadedIndexingStrategy.java:43)
     at com.atlassian.jira.util.concurrent.BoundedExecutor$2.call(BoundedExecutor.java:68)
     at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
     at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
     at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
     at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)

 Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Duplicate keys mapped to com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.vdi.CustomFieldPrefetchedData@22069d65 / com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.vdi.CustomFieldPrefetchedData@6a887793 for custom field id customfield_10001
     at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueDocumentFactory.lambda$processIssueEntry$9(DefaultIssueDocumentFactory.java:186)
     at java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp$OfRef.accept(ForEachOps.java:184)
     at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$2$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:175)
     at java.util.Collections$2.tryAdvance(Collections.java:4717)
     at java.util.Collections$2.forEachRemaining(Collections.java:4725)
     at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471)
     at java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp.evaluateSequential(ForEachOps.java:151)
     at java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp$OfRef.evaluateSequential(ForEachOps.java:174)
     at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
     at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.forEach(ReferencePipeline.java:418)
     at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueDocumentFactory.processIssueEntry(DefaultIssueDocumentFactory.java:177)
     at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueDocumentFactory.lambda$getPersistedFieldsWithData$7(DefaultIssueDocumentFactory.java:166)
     at java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp$OfRef.accept(ForEachOps.java:184)
     at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$2$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:175)
     at java.util.HashMap$EntrySpliterator.forEachRemaining(HashMap.java:1699)
     at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$Head.forEach(ReferencePipeline.java:580)
     at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$7$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:270)
     at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$2$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:175)
     at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:193)
     at java.util.HashMap$KeySpliterator.forEachRemaining(HashMap.java:1556)
     at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:481)
     at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471)
     at java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp.evaluateSequential(ForEachOps.java:151)
     at java.util.stream.ForEachOps$ForEachOp$OfRef.evaluateSequential(ForEachOps.java:174)
     at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
     at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.forEach(ReferencePipeline.java:418)
     at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueDocumentFactory.getPersistedFieldsWithData(DefaultIssueDocumentFactory.java:166)
     at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueDocumentFactory.createDocuments(DefaultIssueDocumentFactory.java:97)
     at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer$DefaultDocumentCreationStrategy.get(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:1332)
     at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer$IssuesOperation.createDocuments(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:982)
     at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer$EntityOperation.perform(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:847)
     ... 10 more
{noformat}
* Note: custom field id _customfield_10001_, in this case Epic CF (com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.epiclink.EpicLinkCFType.EpicLinkCustomFieldProvider) got duplicated. 

h3. Note on fix
The issue has been largely mitigated since the most common scenario was fixed (#1).
The list of all possible scenario for future reference: 
# (/) When two instances of the same provider return the same data and this data can be compared correctly (e.g. Epic Link's type of data is {{IssueImpl}} and for this type we can determine if two ones are equal), we can make sure that both providers returned the same thing and we can turn a blind eye to having two providers.
# (x) When two instances of the same provider return the same data, but it's not comparable (type coming from some other plugin with no {{equals}} implementation), we'll consider this data different.
# (x) When two instances of the same provider return genuinely different data, e.g. the data has changed while indexing (a very unlikely concurrency bug), we'll fail indexing.

h3. Workaround
A restart of the node having this problem
fields.summary: Reindexing process breaks with IllegalStateException due to multiple NonNullCustomFieldProvider

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Search Filters "Shared with" selected option is moving back to the default option "Anyone on the web" after a click on the "Search" button.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Go to Issues -> Manage Filters -> Search -> Search Filters -> Shared with -> Select any option from dropdown (Eg: Project) -> Select the filters -> Click on Search button
h3. Expected Results

As with other search options ( Search/Owner), the entered search criteria for "Shared with" should be stayed until the user delete it.
h3. Actual Results

Entered "Shared with" option is being moved back to the default option (Anyone on the web).
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Search Filters "Shared with" selected option is moving back to the default option

h3. Issue Summary

End-user Audit log set to *Advanced* logging, starts showing logging information for *Full* logging option.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Deploy Jira Data-center on 8.13.2 version
 # Go to Audit log settings.
 # Set End User Activity Log to *Advanced* Logging.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The [Setting configuration properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AUTOMATION/Setting+configuration+properties] document for Automation for Jira (A4J) has some command examples on how to query current value for properties and how to change them.

How the current examples are presented may lead to confusion on how to use the REST API method to perform the above actions, specifically regarding where the Jira Base URL is expected.
\\
\\
For example, this URL is used in one of the examples:
{code}
http://<HOST>:<PORT>/jira/rest/cb-automation/1/configuration/property/
{code}

There's no explanation that {{/jira}} is a context path and should be changed/removed depending on the customer configuration.
\\


h3. Suggested Solution
Instead of using {{http://<HOST>:<PORT>/jira}}, change it for {{<Jira Base URL>}}, such as:
{code}
curl -u <user>:<password>  <Jira Base URL>/rest/cb-automation/1/configuration/property/<PROPERTY_KEY>
{code}
fields.summary: Update Automation for Jira "Setting configuration properties" document

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Automation for Jira third-party action throws ClassCastException when componentInputs.getIssues() is called in concurrent mode
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Build and run the attached "automation-thirdparty-sample-customized.zip" project with "atlas-debug" command. It is a trivially modified version of the official Automation sample app provided by Atlassian ([https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/automation-addon-sample/src/master/automation-thirdparty-sample/)] and modify it as per the "App modification details" section below.
 # Create three issues with keys: SP-1, SP-2, SP-3.
 # Create a new automation rule. Use trigger type "Custom issue created trigger" and add one "New Sample Comment" action (both provided by the sample app). The comment should be "Hello dear!" to avoid some hard-coded error checking.
 # Trigger the automation rule by creating a new issue.
 # Check the Audit Log for the rule's log output.
 # Check the Jira log.

This bug only shows up if all of these conditions are true:
 * the third-party API is used: BOTH the trigger and the action is a third-party component

 * at least one issue returned by the trigger

 * concurrent action execution is requested via .executeConcurrently (which is the recommended method as stated in the API docs)

*App modification details*:

* CustomIssueCreatedTrigger.execute() method is modified in a way to always pass exactly three issues to the rule engine:

AdditionalInputsResultBuilder builder = new AdditionalInputsResultBuilder();
builder.withIssues(Arrays.asList(
ComponentAccessor.getIssueManager().getIssueByKeyIgnoreCase("SP-1"),
ComponentAccessor.getIssueManager().getIssueByKeyIgnoreCase("SP-2"),
ComponentAccessor.getIssueManager().getIssueByKeyIgnoreCase("SP-3")
));

* Additionally the trigger is modified to use concurrent mode:
builder.executeConcurrently();
h3. Expected Results

The rule execution is successful, no errors in the Jira log and the audit log.
h3. Actual Results

The rule execution fails, error in the Jira log and the audit log.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Automation for Jira third-party action throws ClassCastException when componentInputs.getIssues() is called in concurrent mode

fields.description:
The Active Directory flag *UF_ACCOUNTDISABLE* successfully disables a Jira user account, [configured as a user directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-to-an-ldap-directory-938847052.html]. However, in the event an AD user must be re-activated, a Jira Admin must directly manipulate the Jira database to re-activate the user account.

h3.Expected Result
Re-enabling the Active Directory account changes the UF_ACCOUNTDISABLE flag, which resets the {{active}} flag within cwd_user to true.
fields.summary: As a Jira Admin, I want to re-activate Active Directory disabled users with the flag UF_ACCOUNTDISABLE

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira pauses the cluster index replication service when requesting an index snapshot from another node. If the sending node fails to provide an snapshot for any reason, the cluster index replication service will remain paused indefinitely.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Deploy a two-node Jira Data Center cluster. Ensure one of the nodes does not have a valid index, and the other will not be able to provide a valid snapshot. For example, as described in JRASERVER-62669.
 # Start one of the nodes while the other is already up.

h3. Expected Results
 * The starting node will obtain a valid index snapshot from another node.
 * If that does not happen over a certain period of time, the starting node will either request another index snapshot, or at least unpause the index replication service.

h3. Actual Results
 * Starting node requests an index snapshot from any other node in the cluster:
{code:none|title=Starting node requests an index snapshot}
2021-02-14 04:20:41,530+0000 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [c.a.jira.startup.ClusteringLauncher] Checking local index on node start
2021-02-14 04:20:41,534+0000 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [c.a.jira.cluster.DefaultClusterManager] Current node: 10.0.80.208 index can't be rebuilt. Requesting an index from any other node. Current list of other nodes: [10.0.12.156, 10.0.66.220, 10.0.174.242]
(...)
2021-02-14 04:20:41,540+0000 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [c.a.jira.cluster.DefaultClusterManager] Sending message: "Backup Index" - request to create index snapshot from node: ANY on current node: 10.0.80.208
{code}

 * The starting node then *pauses index replication* while waiting for an index snapshot to be provided by another node:
{code:none|title=Starting node pauses index replication}
2021-02-14 04:20:41,534+0000 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService] [INDEX-REPLAY] Pausing node re-index service
java.lang.Exception
    at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.pause(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:213)
    at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.DefaultClusterManager.requestCurrentIndexFromNode(DefaultClusterManager.java:138)
    at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.DefaultClusterManager.checkIndex(DefaultClusterManager.java:131)
    at com.atlassian.jira.startup.ClusteringLauncher.start(ClusteringLauncher.java:37)
    at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.postDBActivated(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:168)
    at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.lambda$postDbLaunch$2(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:146)
    at com.atlassian.jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.doNowOrEnqueue(DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.java:301)
    at com.atlassian.jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.doNowOrWhenDatabaseActivated(DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.java:196)
    at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.postDbLaunch(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:137)
    at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.lambda$start$0(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:104)
    at com.atlassian.jira.util.devspeed.JiraDevSpeedTimer.run(JiraDevSpeedTimer.java:31)
    at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.start(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:102)
    at com.atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener.initSlowStuff(LauncherContextListener.java:154)
    at com.atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener.initSlowStuffInBackground(LauncherContextListener.java:139)
    at com.atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener.contextInitialized(LauncherContextListener.java:101)
    ... 5 filtered
    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{code}

 * The sending node fails to provide an index snapshot for any reason (i.e. due to JRASERVER-62669):
{code:none|title=Sending node fails to provide an index snapshot}
2021-02-14 04:20:42,118+0000 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService] Received message: "Backup Index" - request to create index snapshot from node: 10.0.80.208 on current node: 10.0.12.156
2021-02-14 04:20:42,118+0000 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService] Index backup started. Requesting node: 10.0.80.208, currentNode: 10.0.12.156
2021-02-14 04:20:42,120+0000 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 WARN      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService] Index backup failed - latest index operation not found. Requesting node: 10.0.80.208, currentNode: 10.0.12.156
{code}
This can happen when the requested node is able to provide a good copy too.

 * Starting node will keep waiting for an index snapshot *indefinitely,* while also keeping the replication service paused. Note the timestamps in this snippet, more than a day later:
{code:none}
2021-02-15 10:04:19,691+0000 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-0 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService] [INDEX-REPLAY] Node re-index service is not running: currentNode.isClustered=true, notRunningCounter=21396, paused=true, lastPausedStacktrace=java.lang.Throwable
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService.pause(DefaultNodeReindexService.java:215)
        at com.atlassian.jira.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.reIndexAll(CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.java:62)
        at com.atlassian.jira.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.reIndexAll(CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.java:51)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.doReindex(ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.java:27)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.call(AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.java:63)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.call(ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.java:18)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.call(AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.java:26)
        at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:533)
        at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:491)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at com.atlassian.jira.task.ForkedThreadExecutor$ForkedRunnableDecorator.run(ForkedThreadExecutor.java:216)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{code}

 * Cluster index replication will fall behind in the starting node, eventually leading to a failed *Cluster Index Replication* health check, and symptoms such as:
 ** Missing issues in agile boards.
 ** Searches bringing incomplete or inconsistent results.

h3. Workaround
 * request index from another node via admin panel / Copy the Search Index from another node
 * restore index from index backup
 * restart node
 * LB should not redirect users to node with no index: JRASERVER-66970

{color:#de350b}As of 8.19.0 we introduced fetching index snapshot from shared on startup which will prevent this issues to happen. For this feature to work index snapshot must be available in `export/indexsnapshots` directory of shared home.
 A service creating snapshot of indexes is enabled by default in 24 hours cycle in that version.
 Ticket requesting this feature: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-66649.{color}
fields.summary: Index replication service is paused indefinitely after failing to obtain an index snapshot from another node

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Dashboard - The owner can't edit gadgets when an admin adds "VIEW share" permission to the gadgets

We have disabled "Create Shared Objects" for all users. Only Admins can do. When users want to share, Admins do this for them.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # The user/owner creates a Dashboard and adds a couple of gadgets (private)
 # Now admin searches at Administration>System>Dashboards for this board
 # Admin selects this Dashboard and adds a "View Share" to it either of  Group, project and any logged-in user
 # Now the user/owner of this dashboard cannot edit the gadgets anymore

h3. Expected Results

The user/owner should be able to edit the gadgets after the admin adds view permission for another group, projects, or logged-in user.
h3. Actual Results

The owner of the gadget will no longer be able to edit the gadgets on the dashboard once admin share the gadget with View permission with other Group/project/any logged-in user
h3. Workaround

For a workaround, we need to add the user to the group which has Create Shared Objects permissions under global permissions.

 
{code:java}
Note: owners of filters cannot edit their filters as soon as the filter is shared by an admin.{code}
fields.summary: Dashboard: Owner can't edit gadgets, when admin adds "VIEW share" permission to the dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Issue
When requesting [GET] /rest/api/2/issue/ABC-123, Jira attempts on finding the issue ABC-123 before validating if user can perform the request. Furthermore, it provides information about inexistent issue.

h3. How to replicate?
{code}
curl -k https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/issue/ABC-123
{"errorMessages":["Issue Does Not Exist"],"errors":{}}
{code}

h3. Where in the source code?
JIRA_INSTALL/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/jira-rest-plugin-8.5.5.jar#com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.IssueResource

h3. Expected result
Login is required and no other information should be provided

h3. Actual Result
Issue Does Not Exist
fields.summary: Jira REST API should not give away information when anonymous request is made

fields.description:
As a Jira Admin running an LTS release (Jira 8.5), the customer notices the release does not include a fix for at least the critical fix for [CVE-2020-17527|https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-17527].

h3.Solution:
Bundle {{Application Server Apache Tomcat/8.5.60}} with a Jira LTS bug-fix release (8.5.x).


h3.Notes:
See [Bundled Tomcat and Java versions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/bundled-tomcat-and-java-versions-1013854250.html] and [How to Upgrade Tomcat Version used by Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-upgrade-apache-tomcat-version-used-by-jira-879957866.html] for up-to-date release information and how to upgrade Tomcat manually (not supported by Atlassian Support per our [Support Offerings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-support-offerings-193299636.html]).
fields.summary: As a Jira Admin, I want the 8.5 Long-Term Support release to include critical Tomcat updates

fields.description:
When administration sections is accessed on Jira (or Confluence), the requests generates two additional cookies:
 * *ajs_user_id*
 * *ajs_anonymous_id*

These cookies are being generated under a different domain than the other cookies.
h4. Example:
 * All other cookies (like JSESSIONID) has domain like "_jira.mydomain.com_"
 * These two cookies "_ajs_user_id"_ and "_ajs_anonymous_id_*"* have the domain "_.mydomain.com_" (this is not considering the subdomain).

h3. Issue

This is causing security issues since there are other apps under the same domain (but with different subdomains).
h3. Expected Result

The domain of the cookies are under the same domain as the other cookies (like JSESSIONID).
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Add cookies "ajs_user_id" and "ajs_anonymous_id" on the subdomain

fields.description:
The issue navigation & search view in Jira Server and Data Center before version 8.5.12, from version 8.6.0 before version 8.13.4, and from version 8.14.0 before version 8.15.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript via a DOM Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability caused by parameter pollution.

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.5.12
 * 8.6.0 ≤ version < 8.13.4
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.15.1

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.5.12
 * 8.13.4
 * 8.15.1

Atlassian would like to credit Peter af Geijerstam for reporting this issue.
fields.summary: DOM XSS in the issue navigation & search view via parameter pollution - CVE-2020-36288

fields.description:
In JIRA 6.x, 7.x, or 8.x, it is possible to [rename a project key|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Editing+a+Project+Key?from=SvEC]. However, it is not possible to reuse a project key that was previously used in Jira, even if the original key has been changed.

Even archiving a Project, Jira will still keep the history of already used keys.
h4. Current Behavior:
 * Let's say the user has renamed a project key from "ABC" to "KLM"
 * Although there is no project that uses the project key ABC, the user is *not* allowed to re-use "ABC" for the new project key.

h4. Suggested behavior:
 * Ideally, the user should be able to re-use the project key "ABC" for other/new project, once the project key has been altered to "KLM".

h4. Workaround
 * Currently, there is +*no workaround*+ to re-use a project key.

h4. (!) DO NOT use SQL queries to change DB tables to try to re-use keys.

This will lead to database inconsistencies as projects are connected to issues, attachments, permissions, workflows, plugins, custom scripts, and etc..
fields.summary: Provide the ability to reuse a project key once its original value is altered

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
 * Field type "Participants of an issue" is not available on the Issue view. The *Participants* field is a calculated custom field, meaning that users are not expected to edit it - instead it derives its value automatically from: reporter, current assignee and all commenters of the issue. ([Documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/custom-fields-types-in-classic-projects/])

{panel:title=Reproducing the Problem|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
 - Create a new custom field of type "Participants of an issue"
 - Associate that custom field to a screens
 - Create an issue and set some values while creating the issue on the custom field.
 - View the Issue after creation and the custom field is not present on the *new issue view.*
 - switch to the *old issue view* and the custom field is visible.{panel}
h3. *Expected Result*
 * Custom field should be displayed on the new issue view

h3. *Actual Result*
 * Custom field is not visible on the new issue view

h3. *Work Around*
 * Switch to the Old Issue view to be able to see the custom field.
 *OR*
 * View the issue in the Issue Navigator
fields.summary: Field type "Participants of an issue" not available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If there is a corrupt entry in app_user and cwd_user data(user name is a blank/empty string) for any user for example something like below:

select * from cwd_user cu where id = 10104
 !Screenshot 2021-02-14 at 1.35.17 PM.png|thumbnail! 

select * from app_user au where id = 10104
 !Screenshot 2021-02-14 at 1.36.04 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Resetting an already exiting project's component lead, overwrites the none value to this corrupt entry.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create the corrupt entry as show above by removing the user name details from a user as shown in the screenshots.
# Make an existing user the component lead of any component.
# Flush the user cache or simply restart the servers.
# Remove the user (added in step 2). Instead of the component lead being empty, user in step 1 will show up as a component lead.

h3. Expected Results

Component lead should get reset to none, if we are willing to do so.

h3. Actual Results

Component lead gets set to missing user name entry.

h3. Workaround

Manually, edit the user record on UI to make sure they contain user name. Looks like we are making call to record based upon username and while resetting user name to none, a query to empty username get call is made which gets matched to the existing corrupt record in DB.
fields.summary: Empty("") username entry for any user overwrites the component lead data if you are resetting the lead in UI

Upon a restart of the Jira instance or a certain period of time (roughly a week), the field is reverted to *Required* automatically.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is not currently possible to create child issues from within the issue view for issue types that are created and configured as additional levels of hierarchy. The default Epic, Story, Task, and Sub-task issue types support this but custom issue types in the hierarchy do not.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow child issue creation from the issue view for custom issue types in the current hierarchy.
 
h3. Workaround 
Create the child issues manually and then link them to the desired parent via setting the Parent Link field or by dragging the issues underneath the desired parent in the plan view and then saving the changes to Jira.
fields.summary: Show Create Child Issue Option in Issue View for Custom Issue Types in the Hierarchy

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User mentions and assignee lookup are slow with Jira 8.14+/JSM 4.14+. Performance regression started after Jira upgrade from the previous LTS 8.13 to 8.14 release and this was caused by the internal upgrade of the Embedded Crowd to 4.2.0+ version. 
 EmbCrowd requests create an additional load on DB since {{UserDao}} method doesn't have a specific cache.
h3. Environments Affected

Jira Software - all versions between 8.14 and 8.19.0
Jira Service Management - all versions between 4.14 and 4.19.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup Jira with large user base (50k+)
 # Created new Jira project and issue
 # @ mention user in the issue comment

h3. Expected Results

@ mention user lookup result returns instantaneously, especially the one that user have searched recently/repeatedly
h3. Actual Results

@ mention user lookup takes a substantial amount of time (few minutes) to return the list of matching users
h3. Investigation

No error from logs.

Capturing the SQL logs in local testing, we noticed that Jira is querying every user:
 * every internal user against internal directory once e.g:
{code:java}
2021-01-22 21:16:57,072+1100 http-nio-48140-exec-9 admin 1276x1590x1 12f88sa /rest/internal/2/user/mention/search 1ms "SELECT user_name FROM public.cwd_user WHERE (lower_user_name =  'admin' ) AND (directory_id =  '1' ) ORDER BY lower_user_name"
2021-01-22 21:16:57,072+1100 http-nio-48140-exec-9 admin 1276x1590x1 12f88sa /rest/internal/2/user/mention/search 1ms Connection returned. borrowed : 0
2021-01-22 21:16:57,072+1100 http-nio-48140-exec-9 admin 1276x1590x1 12f88sa /rest/internal/2/user/mention/search 0ms Connection taken. borrowed : 1{code}

 * every LDAP user against the internal directory and every LDAP integrated with Jira e.g:
{code:java}
2021-01-22 21:16:57,097+1100 http-nio-48140-exec-9 admin 1276x1590x1 12f88sa /rest/internal/2/user/mention/search 1ms "SELECT user_name FROM public.cwd_user WHERE (lower_user_name =  'jack' ) AND (directory_id =  '1' ) ORDER BY lower_user_name"
2021-01-22 21:16:57,097+1100 http-nio-48140-exec-9 admin 1276x1590x1 12f88sa /rest/internal/2/user/mention/search 1ms Connection returned. borrowed : 0
2021-01-22 21:16:57,097+1100 http-nio-48140-exec-9 admin 1276x1590x1 12f88sa /rest/internal/2/user/mention/search 0ms Connection taken. borrowed : 1
2021-01-22 21:16:57,098+1100 http-nio-48140-exec-9 admin 1276x1590x1 12f88sa /rest/internal/2/user/mention/search 1ms "SELECT user_name FROM public.cwd_user WHERE (lower_user_name =  'jack' ) AND (directory_id =  '10000' ) ORDER BY lower_user_name"
2021-01-22 21:16:57,098+1100 http-nio-48140-exec-9 admin 1276x1590x1 12f88sa /rest/internal/2/user/mention/search 1ms Connection returned. borrowed : 0
2021-01-22 21:16:57,099+1100 http-nio-48140-exec-9 admin 1276x1590x1 12f88sa /rest/internal/2/user/mention/search 0ms Connection taken. borrowed : 1{code}

This same is not observed with similar setup in Jira 8.13.

With the above findings, a lot of queries are hitting the Jira database especially if many users are sync from LDAP and/or there are multiple LDAPs integrated with Jira.

The same amount of queries are incurred, despite repeatedly @ mentioning the same user in the same issue.
h3. Workaround

Reduce the users synchronized from the external directory as Jira may scan the whole database table in some corner cases. Doing this will also help with performance improvements in other areas. 
 [Reducing the number of users synchronized from LDAP to JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/reducing-the-number-of-users-synchronized-from-ldap-to-jira-applications-938847054.html]
fields.summary: Performance regression in user lookup

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When starting Jira 8.13 in Disaster Recovery mode, the index restoration, from a snapshot, fails.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an index snapshot as instructed [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/considerations-for-jira-index-snapshots-720638070.html]
 ** Note that you can't create a snapshot on demand but rather wait for the Cron to execute in the specified time
 # After the index snapshot has been generated, stop Jira
 ** (i) If you don't have a DR environment set up, you can replicate in your *test* environment as follows:
 ** Remove the folder {{/<sharedhome>/indexarchive/}}
 ** Enable DR by adding {{disaster.recovery=true}} to {{jira-config.properties}}
 ** Remove index folders from your Jira node {{$JIRA-HOME/caches/indexesV1}}
 # Start Jira in DR mode

h3. Expected Results

Index restoration is completed successfully from the snapshot in the first start-up and Jira start correctly.
h3. Actual Results

Starting as of Jira 8.10, 8.11, and 8.12, there are changes in how Jira perform reindex operations (and also introduced index versioning) and looks like the index snapshot recovery is being called from a thread that doesn't provide the Jira context, hence failing as we can see below:
{noformat}
2021-02-11 15:04:07,546+0000 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager] [INDEX-FIXER] Re-indexing issues updated in the last {1 days, 0 hours, 30 minutes, and 23 seconds}. (Note: it's an intentionally wider range)
2021-02-11 15:04:07,546+0000 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager] [INDEX-FIXER] Recovering search indexes - 60% complete... [INDEX-FIXER] Re-indexing issues modified in the last {1 days, 0 hours, 30 minutes, and 23 seconds}. $
2021-02-11 15:04:07,577+0000 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [c.a.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener] Unable to start JIRA.
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Incorrect usage of JIRA/lucene search API. You can only create/use: ManagedIndexSearcher inside a context (request or Jira-Thread-Local). Check: JiraThreadLocalUtils for details.
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ManagedIndexSearcherFactory.createFrom(ManagedIndexSearcherFactory.java:15)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.ThreadLocalSearcherCache$Cache.retrieveEntitySearcher(ThreadLocalSearcherCache.java:142)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.ThreadLocalSearcherCache.getSearcher(ThreadLocalSearcherCache.java:40)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.getEntitySearcher(DefaultIndexManager.java:930)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        ... 2 filtered
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:38)
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy37.getEntitySearcher(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.jira.versioning.EntityVersioningManagerImpl.getSearcher(EntityVersioningManagerImpl.java:322)
        at com.atlassian.jira.versioning.EntityVersioningManagerImpl.getLocalVersionsInOneQuery(EntityVersioningManagerImpl.java:169)
        at com.atlassian.jira.versioning.EntityVersioningManagerImpl.getLocalVersions(EntityVersioningManagerImpl.java:160)
        at com.atlassian.jira.versioning.EntityVersioningManagerWithStats.getLocalVersions(EntityVersioningManagerWithStats.java:252)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.getCorrespondingEntityIndexVersions(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:346)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.filterOutAlreadyIndexedEntities(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:335)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.reindexOutdatedEntities(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:290)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.reindexWithVersionCheckEntitiesUpdatedInTheLast(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:239)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.recoverIndexFromBackup(DefaultIndexRecoveryManager.java:173)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DisasterRecoveryLauncher.restoreIndex(DisasterRecoveryLauncher.java:108)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DisasterRecoveryLauncher.start(DisasterRecoveryLauncher.java:68)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.postDBActivated(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:174)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.lambda$postDbLaunch$2(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:146)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.doNowOrEnqueue(DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.java:301)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.doNowOrWhenDatabaseActivated(DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.java:196)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.postDbLaunch(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:137)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.lambda$start$0(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:104)
        at com.atlassian.jira.util.devspeed.JiraDevSpeedTimer.run(JiraDevSpeedTimer.java:31)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.start(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:102)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener.initSlowStuff(LauncherContextListener.java:154)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener.initSlowStuffInBackground(LauncherContextListener.java:139)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener.contextInitialized(LauncherContextListener.java:101)
        ... 5 filtered
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 # Start Jira without Disaster Recovery mode
 # Go to *Cog > System > Index*
 # Restore the index manually using the snapshot name, which should be located in {{/<shared-home/import/indexsnapshot}}
fields.summary: Index snapshot restore fails and Jira does not start in Disaster Recovery mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As per the documentation on [Archiving an issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver083/archiving-an-issue-976768211.html], each exported issue contains the following fields: system fields, archived by, archive date, and the URL, which is the direct link to the issue.
 However, not all the fields are exported while doing a CSV (ALL) export.

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Login to Jira as a [Jira System Administrator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver083/managing-global-permissions-976767808.html].
 # Browser through  *!https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver083/files/976768211/976768216/1/1568053897407/Screen+Shot+2019-03-05+at+13.43.49.png|width=16!  > System > Import & Export > Archived Issues*
 # Click on Export and choose "CSV (ALL)"
 # The CSV file only contains the following fields:
 Id,Project,Key,URL,Issue Type,Status,Creator,Reporter,Assignee,Archived by,Archived date,Summary,Description,Archived state

*Current Output:*
The CSV file only contains the following fields: 
 Id,Project,Key,URL,Issue Type,Status,Creator,Reporter,Assignee,Archived by,Archived date,Summary,Description,Archived state

*Expected Output:*
 The CSV (ALL) export should include all System files by default.
fields.summary: Exporting Archived Issues using CSV (ALL) method should include All System Fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whenever you are selecting FIx Version/s and Affects Version/s if the release name is too long and there are several similar names, Jira will not display the entire name or display a tooltip with the complete name, so the user can distinguish between the different options.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create several releases with a long name (in this case we used 60 characters long).
 # Include both the *Affects Version/s* and *Fix Version/s* fields in the *View and Edit Screens* associated with your project's issues.
 # Try to select one of the options using inline editing or through the *Edit Issue Screen*.

h3. Expected Results
* The entire name of the release will be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
* The name of the release is only partially displayed and a tooltip is not provided as well, so users have no way of distinguishing between the different options.

 !Screen Shot 2021-02-10 at 18.15.50.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

* *Suggested Solution*:

* A definitive solution would be for the field to auto-adjust itself depending on the size of the options.
* Also, a tooltip could be displayed when mousing over the options.
fields.summary: Fix Version/s and Affects Version/s - Release names are not completely displayed if they are too long

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When setting up a Request Type in Service Management, you can Edit the Request type to include help and hidden fields.  

The 'Help & Instructions' and 'Field Help' text will not properly render multiple links when used with the (!) emoji.

Secondary issue: It will also not allow you to add line breaks.  If you want line breaks, you have to type out the entire text of what you want in another text editor (doesn't matter what kind) and then paste it into these fields. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to *Service Management project > Project Settings > Request Types.*
 # Click on Edit next to a request type. 
 # Enter text with multiple links (constructed in the "[ description | link ]" format)
 # Put an (!) emoji in front of each link
 # Save your changes.

h3. Expected Results

You can add multiple links with the (!) emoji in front of each, and line breaks like you can with both visual and text mode comments. 
h3. Actual Results

The first link does not render correctly and you cannot add line breaks. 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

For line breaks, you can add these in another text editor and then copy/paste the text into these fields.
fields.summary: Request Type 'Help & Instructions' and 'Field Help' text will not render the first of multiple links with '(!)' emoji

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Currently, Jira uses the default LDAP Locked Account Check attribute for checking if the user is active on the directory, and this is hard-coded attributes.

h2. Suggestion

It would be nice from the Jira UI, while configuring an OpenLDAP directory, the *user status* could be mapped as well other attributes like _User Object Class_, or _User Name Attribute_ for Jira to check if the user is active or disabled.

h2. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this
fields.summary: LDAP Custom status attribute

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Jira has SAML/SSO enabled as per [*OpenID Connect for Atlassian Data Center applications*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/openid-connect-for-atlassian-data-center-applications-987142159.html] and any user tries to edit their own details via {{/secure/ViewProfile.jspa}} they are requested for a password.
Since the users are authenticating via SSO, any password informed is considered invalid.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Jira to authenticate via SSO.
# Login to Jira.
# Go to *Profile*
# Click on the {{pencil}} icon to edit the profile.
# Change any field on this screen, inform the password and try to save.

h3. Expected Results

Users are able to edit their information by either informing their SSO password or without being requested for a password at all.

h3. Actual Results

Users cannot edit their own information, since they are unable to provide a valid password.


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users can't edit their profile when SSO OpenID is enabled

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian, we need more granularity on manage permissions for people that are Administrators (role Administrator) inside a Jira Project or Service Desk Project.
Here the requirement as a Story:

*As *Project Adminstrator 
I want the possibility to:
1. Add existing people to a specific existing group 
2. Remove existing people to a specific existing group
3. Edit Properties, Triggers, Conditions, Validators, Post Functions to workflow transitions
4. Edit Issue Types (selecting an existing one)
5. Add workflows to my projects
6. Add Custom Fields to the Default Field Configuration (with approval by the jira-administrators)
7. Use a different issue type schema (selecting only an existing one)
8. Use a different Workflow Scheme (selecting only an existing one)
9. Use a different Screen Schemas (selecting only an existing one)
10.Use a different Field Configuration (selecting only an existing one)
11. Use a different Notification Schema (selecting only an existing one)
fields.summary: Extended Permissions for Administrators inside a Jira Project (Delegate permissions)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users, while searching for sprints in the advance search, Triggers rest API calls like below which are (nothing but autocomplete suggestions) and these are causing very HIGH CPU utilisation and load. 
{code}
GET /rest/api/2/jql/autocompletedata/suggestions?fieldName=Sprint&fieldValue=A&_=1609757846274 
{code}

And this is the referrer 
{code}
https://<JIRA>/issues/?jql=Status%20not%20in%20(closed%2Cdone)%20and%20Sprint%20is%20not%20EMPTY%20"
{code}

All these are browser sessions. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
N/A
Can be reproduced with more than 30k+ sprints and going to advance search and search for sprints. 

h3. Expected Results
The autocomplete shouldn't spike CPU and the response of the request should be quicker

h3. Actual Results

CPU utlization shoots up and with an increasing number of threads going into Sprint autocomplete code, higher the spike and CPU load average. 

Here is the snippet of the thread causing high CPU
The code that is invoked with the above call is 
{code}
	at org.apache.lucene.util.FixedBitSet.<init>(FixedBitSet.java:115)
	at org.apache.lucene.util.DocIdSetBuilder.upgradeToBitSet(DocIdSetBuilder.java:235)
	at org.apache.lucene.util.DocIdSetBuilder.grow(DocIdSetBuilder.java:178)
	at org.apache.lucene.util.DocIdSetBuilder.add(DocIdSetBuilder.java:156)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.TermInSetQuery$1.rewrite(TermInSetQuery.java:261)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.TermInSetQuery$1.scorer(TermInSetQuery.java:313)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.Weight.scorerSupplier(Weight.java:113)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.LRUQueryCache$CachingWrapperWeight.scorerSupplier(LRUQueryCache.java:714)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanWeight.scorerSupplier(BooleanWeight.java:329)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.LRUQueryCache$CachingWrapperWeight.scorerSupplier(LRUQueryCache.java:714)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanWeight.scorerSupplier(BooleanWeight.java:329)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanWeight.scorer(BooleanWeight.java:295)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.Weight.bulkScorer(Weight.java:147)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanWeight.bulkScorer(BooleanWeight.java:289)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.LRUQueryCache$CachingWrapperWeight.bulkScorer(LRUQueryCache.java:795)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.search(IndexSearcher.java:657)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.search(IndexSearcher.java:462)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelegateSearcher.search(DelegateSearcher.java:169)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelegateSearcher.search(DelegateSearcher.java:169)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.UnmanagedIndexSearcher.search(UnmanagedIndexSearcher.java:9)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DelegateSearcher.search(DelegateSearcher.java:169)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.ManagedIndexSearcher.search(ManagedIndexSearcher.java:15)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.getHitCount(LuceneSearchProvider.java:178)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.getHitCount(LuceneSearchProvider.java:145)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.search.DefaultSearchService.searchCount(DefaultSearchService.java:130)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1742.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.util.ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.java:26)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy439.searchCount(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1742.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.bridge.external.HostComponentFactoryBean$DynamicServiceInvocationHandler.invoke(HostComponentFactoryBean.java:131)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy439.searchCount(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.SprintPermissionServiceImpl.getIssueCountForSprint(SprintPermissionServiceImpl.java:250)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.SprintPermissionServiceImpl.canViewSprint(SprintPermissionServiceImpl.java:90)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.sprint.SprintResolver.checkSprintAccessible(SprintResolver.java:31)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.sprint.SprintResolver$SprintAccessible.apply(SprintResolver.java:139)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.sprint.SprintResolver$SprintAccessible.apply(SprintResolver.java:125)
	at com.google.common.base.Predicates$AndPredicate.apply(Predicates.java:353)
	at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$5.computeNext(Iterators.java:639)
	at com.google.common.collect.AbstractIterator.tryToComputeNext(AbstractIterator.java:141)
	at com.google.common.collect.AbstractIterator.hasNext(AbstractIterator.java:136)
	at com.google.common.collect.Iterators.addAll(Iterators.java:357)
	at com.google.common.collect.Lists.newArrayList(Lists.java:147)
	at com.google.common.collect.Lists.newArrayList(Lists.java:133)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.sprint.SprintResolver.findSprintByPredicate(SprintResolver.java:78)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.sprint.SprintResolver.findSprintByPredicate(SprintResolver.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.sprint.SprintClauseValueGenerator.getPossibleValues(SprintClauseValueGenerator.java:40)
{code}


h3. Workaround
* One workaround could be to disable the autocomplete (which is not so pleasant workaround.) 
* Another effective workaround could be to delay the requests which are sending the autocomplete suggestion. That is, adding the below JS in the announcement Banner
{code}
<script type='text/javascript'>
	jQuery().ready(function() {

		$('textarea[id="advanced-search"]').focusin( function f() {	
			if (!window.dirtypatch){ // trying avoid adding same event listener more than once 
				setTimeout(
					function() {
						console.log("patching AutoComplete delay");
						JIRA.AutoComplete.delay =  function delay(callback, l) {
							if (delay.t) {
								clearTimeout(delay.t);
								delay.t = undefined;
							}
							delay.t = setTimeout(callback, 1 * 1000); // default is 0.3 * 1000
						};
					}, 1000); // patch is applied a second after search text are is focused, 
							  // to give time for other initialization 
				window.dirtypatch = 1;
			}	
		})
	});
</script>
{code}
fields.summary: Autocomplete suggestions of sprint while doing a JQL search for sprints causing very high CPU utilization.

h3. Issue Summary

Old Assignees are lost after project import when using inbuilt post-function '_The *Assignee* of the issue will be *cleared*.'_
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have an XML backup for Project import with tickets already having an Assignee and ensure that the source project has the workflow including the below post function in the Create transition  '_The *Assignee* of the issue will be *cleared*.'_
 !image-2021-02-08-20-10-08-526.png|width=341,height=173!
 # Create the target project, workflow including the below post function in the Create transition '_The *Assignee* of the issue will be *cleared*.'_
 !screenshot-2 (3).png|width=461,height=98!
 # Start the Project Import
 !image-2021-02-08-20-11-34-841.png|width=254,height=231!
 # Check the target project, the tickets have lost the old Assignees (they are updated as per the workflow post function)
 !image-2021-02-08-20-12-37-452.png|width=422,height=207!

h3. Expected Results

Old Assignee's values should be retained
h3. Actual Results

Old Assignee's values are replaced as per the post function value in the target instance
h3. Workaround

This post function works well for the newly created issues, as a workaround, before the project import, we can remove the post function, perform the project import and then add this post function back to the project

The [Deprecated API|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/8.12.0/deprecated-list.html] and [Atlassian Jira - Server API|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/8.12.0/overview-summary.html] pages don't provide much information on the new APIs since these are not specifically part of Jira and we happen to not publish any Java API docs from the Jira side, hence the need for this documentation.

 # Create an app with index configuration as per snippet A below.
 # Store issue properties with an array payload as per snippet B.

{code:java}
<index-document-configuration entity-key="IssueProperty" key="our-property">
  <key property-key="our.poperty">
    <extract path="count" type="number" alias="count"/>
    <extract path="ids" type="string" alias="ourId"/>
  </key>
</index-document-configuration>
{code}

{code:java}
{
  "key": "our.property",

}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When one of the top-level drop-down menus is expanded and is larger than the browser window size, the top navigation bar disappears above the window.

It happens even when using the minimum supported screen resolution 1024x768.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Browse to an issue
 # Shrink the browser window enough to make one of the top menus larger than the window
 # Click on one top menu (for instance, Issues). The top menu disappears to make room for the menu
 # Click elsewhere on the screen to close the menu
 # The top menu stays hidden

h3. Expected Results

The top menu should be displayed again once the drop-down is closed.
h3. Actual Results

The top menu keeps hidden.
h3. Workaround

fields.description:
When running the Field optimizer functionality, if the custom field is used and there are values defined in this field, the Optimizer will identify the field is used by X project and when we click on 'Change context', it adds the relevant project context to it.

However, if the custom field was not in use, the Optimizer will identify the field is used by 0 projects and when we click on 'Change context', it removes the context from this custom field, which can cause fields to be hidden.

It would be good to have the option presented to the Jira admin when such a situation occurs.
fields.summary: Field Optimizer should allow Jira admins to choose if context should be removed for fields without value

fields.description:
Referring to the change of UI for Project Role Users introduced in 8.6 - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-6-x-release-notes-978220007.html#JiraSoftware8.6.xreleasenotes-usersroles]

 

In my opinion this new view is not a good change. It is confusing to look at and to work with. It effectively manages to show less and make you search more, it does not show you which project roles are being used in the project.

I believe that this new view has managed to do the exact opposite of what it advertised. The old layout worked perfectly fine.

 

I'd like to propose that a user has an option to use the old page layout rather than being forced to use the new one.

fields.description:
Currently, the Modern HTTP Protocols health check description does not include that it runs only if latency related issues are detected on the network.

This can lead to a false-positive interpretation of the check, where most of the time the check passes, and fails only randomly, thus, giving a false impression that the Modern HTTP Protocols (i.e. HTTP2) are enabled, but it's actually not and the healtcheck executed only because a latency related issue wad detected by Jira

The gist of the issue here is that, there's a complex algorithm involved which determines whether to run the check or not. In short, the check will only get executed if Jira detects latency related issues on the network (for example, when more than 10% of the transfer costs are above 2500ms)

This feature request is to make the health check more descriptive, namely that the actual protocols check will run *only* if latency related issues are detected
fields.summary: Modern HTTP Protocols health check to include more details on how exactly it works

fields.description:
As an idP Administrator, I would like to be able to select the attributes including user details and group memberships to be updated upon JIT provisioning.

At present, Jira's JIT provisioning functionality requires an absolute group attribute and it cannot be blank. Putting a dummy attribute will trigger an error.
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-09 at 4.48.44 PM.png|thumbnail! 

(i) Existing group memberships defined in Jira will be replaced by the group attribute defined in the idP.

In most use-case for JIT, there is an option to allow group attributes to be synced or not and users will be added to a default group like {{jira-users}}. Currently, third-party apps offer JIT provisioning with such capability.
fields.summary: Make JIT Group Attribute Sync optional and add Default Group Membership

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The users are not able to move the tabs to the first line if there are many tabs:
 !Screenshot 2021-02-04 at 11.51.15.png! 
 It looks like the tabs cannot be moved because of the description above the tabs (_Note: when the screen is shown to the user only non-hidden fields that the user has permissions to edit will be actually displayed._)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create tabs at least you have them in three lines as shown on the screenshot above
 # Try to move one of the tabs to the FIELD1. You will not be able to move it.

h3. Expected Results

We should be able to move the tabs wherever we want
h3. Actual Results

Tabs cannot be moved
h3. Workaround

Zoom out the page, then you will be able to move the tab to the FIELD1
fields.summary: The tabs on the issue screens cannot be moved if there are many of them

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allow unauthenticated remote attackers to view custom field options via an Information Disclosure vulnerability in the /rest/api/2/customFieldOption/ endpoint.

 

The affected versions are before version 8.15.0.

 

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.15.0

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.15.0
fields.summary: Custom field options are exposed via an unauthenticated REST API endpoint - CVE-2020-36237

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition
At the moment, when admins try to associate project schemes (issue type scheme, priority scheme, etc) to multiple projects, admins need to *press the cmd/ctrl key while choosing the project*. 

Some possible scenarios:
* Mis-pressing command key, all of the selected projects will get deselected.
* Admins won't necessarily remember the initial list of associated projects.
* In enterprise-scale instance, with a long list of projects, this way of selecting multiple projects is inconvenient and not scalable.

(i) Even though we have options to associate project and scheme via REST API, the call doesn't support a situation where mapping value from initial scheme to value in a new scheme is required.

h4. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have a better way of selecting multiple projects when associating project schemes. For example:
* Having a check box for projects to be selected, or 
* Having a project picker type of field where Jira will auto-suggest project names when admin starts typing.
* A method where selected projects won't automatically get deselected when mis-clicking something.
fields.summary: Having a better way of selecting multiple projects when associating project schemes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing the JQL of a Series in Service Management, very complex JQL will cause the Save button at the bottom of the screen to be inaccessible.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a Series.
 # Enter a highly complex JQL that takes up more space than is in the display box.

h3. Expected Results

A scroll bar will appear to allow users to scroll to the bottom of the display box. 
h3. Actual Results

The Save button becomes inaccessible. 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: In Edit a Series screen, Long JQL queries push Save button off-screen

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript via a Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Screens Modal view.

The affected versions are before version 8.5.11, from version 8.6.0 before 8.13.3, and from version 8.14.0 before 8.15.0.

 

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.5.11
 * 8.6.0 ≤ version < 8.13.3
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.15.0

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.5.11
 * 8.13.3
 * 8.15.0
fields.summary: Stored XSS via Custom Fields on Screens Modal - CVE-2020-36234

fields.description: Instead of changing the comment order (descending vs. ascending) globally, can we change this for individual user or individual projects?
fields.summary: Ability to change comment order per user or per project

fields.description:
h3. Issue

When searching for a user in any user picker field (such as the reporter field), 3 pieces of information are displayed:
- the user's display name
- the user's email address
- the user's username

SCREENSHOT

h3. Suggestion

Allow the Jira Administrator to customize which information will be displayed in the user picker fields, and which information will be hidden.
fields.summary: Customize what information is shown when search for users in a user picker field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Abruptly stopping node while project reindex is in progress causes inability to reindex Jira. 
This problem is a more specific version of JRASERVER-47045

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run a project reindex on node 1
 # Abruptly terminate Jira process on node 1
 # On node 2, go to Jira settings > System > Indexing page

h3. Expected Results
Upon visiting Indexing page on node 2, reindexing operations are available.

h3. Actual Results
Re-indexing operations are not available. The following message is displayed:
{quote}The 'Lock Jira and rebuild index' option is unavailable while other indexing operations are in progress. See the Jira log for more details.
{quote}
!image-2021-02-03-13-22-49-743.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
* If on Jira 8.5.4, 8.8.0 or higher, the stale task will get automatically removed within 30 minutes, that will self-resolve the problem (/) (see - JRASERVER-66204)
* Otherwise, restart the node that initiated the task, so the stale task gets cleared.
** if it's hard to understand which node initiated the task, you can do a rolling restart.
fields.summary: Abruptly stopping node while project reindex is in progress causes inability to reindex Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While Batching is turned on, the *Affects Version/s* field is shown as *Version* in the email notifications. The field is shown correctly as *Affects Version/s* when batching is off.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Turn on Batching
 # Update the *Affects Version/s* field in a ticket and wait for the notification

h3. Expected Results

The notification email should have the update with field name as '*Affects Version/s*'

!Screenshot 2021-02-03 at 3.06.32 PM.png|width=301,height=57!
h3. Actual Results

The field name is shown as 'Version' in the email notification
 !Screenshot 2021-02-03 at 2.55.07 PM.png|width=291,height=117!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: While Batching is turned on, the Affects Version/s field is shown as Version in the email notifications

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center use a version of jQuery that is vulnerable to CVE-2020-11022 and CVE-2020-11023. These allow an unauthenticated attacker to inject Javascript into the application via Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities.

 

The affected versions are before version 8.15.0.

 

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.15.0

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.15.0
fields.summary: Update jQuery to avoid CVE-2020-11022 and CVE-2020-11023
Allow selecting to add columns Satisfaction Comment and •Satisfaction Date* to the JQL results.
