fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JIRA UI is not consistent for user upgrading from version 8.5 to 8.13
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upgrade Jira from 8.5 to 8.13 as Long term supported release
 # Observe the UI element is not consistent on below
 ** Application navigator shows a gap to next icon
 ** "help", "settings" and "feedback" icons are having higher icon size than expected

h3. Expected Results
 * "help", "settings" and "feedback" icons should be of size 16
 --aui-icon-size: 16px;
 * no gaps between application navigator with next icon
 !Screen Shot 2021-02-01 at 12.11.06 pm.png!

h3. Actual Results
 * "help", "settings" and "feedback" icons should be of size 24
 --aui-icon-size: 24px;
 !Screen Shot 2021-02-01 at 12.01.28 pm.png!

 * A gaps between application navigator with next icon
 !jira8133_app_navigator.png!

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. AN overriding CSS style needs to be applied on banner announcement.
fields.summary: JIRA UI inconsistency on version 8.13.3+

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing {{Administration > Applications > Versions & licenses}} on Jira, users are informed that Jira Core 8.15.0 is available for download, even though its release is still pending.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Jira 8.14.1 (latest available version at the moment)
# Go to  {{Administration > Applications > Versions & licenses}}

h3. Expected Results
No upgrades will be recommended.

h3. Actual Results
A message {{Jira Core 8.15.0 is now available.}} will appear instead.

h3. Workaround
No available workaround, though this message can be ignored.
fields.summary: Jira informs users that Jira Core 8.15.0 is available, though it wasn't released yet

fields.description:
h2.Summary

When requesting for status /rest/api/2/status while unauthenticated Jira is giving 200 OK with empty response while it should return 401 as per the standard or a 404 as per the documentation:

[REST API status get status|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.13.1/#api/2/status-getStatuses]

 !Screenshot_2021-01-29_at_14_53_14.jpg|thumbnail! 

This is misleading and should be rectified.
fields.summary: /rest/api/2/status returns empty result instead of error when unauthenticated request is made

fields.description:
As a sprint admin I’d like to limit what can be included in the sprint.

In Jira 7.1, we introduced *Manage Sprints* permission. See [Sprint Management permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-1-x-release-notes-788728210.html#JIRASoftware7.1.xreleasenotes-managesprintsSprintmanagementpermissions]. This has the sprints to be associated with a board in order to identify the correct permission that should be given to the sprint for "Manage Sprints" permission. 

h3. Suggested Solution
But in order to have a better Sprint “governance”, it would be good to have a more flexible permissions settings.
So the sprint manager can limit the issues that can be added to the sprint.
p.e: Sprint manager limit the “Sprint 1”, AND can only have items from the “Scrum Board 25” added to it.
fields.summary: As a sprint admin I’d like to limit what can be included in the sprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible that background indexing tasks (like Background indexing, SLA recalculation and others) may fill up the indexer queue and affect user create/update issue/comment operation by:
 * slowing down create/update issue/comment user request operations 
 * timing out user indexing requests ({{IndexException: Wait attempt timed out...}}) which will results in an error shown after 30sec to users and may result in changes not being visible index

There are couple of factors which will result in increasing the possibility of having this problem when triggering background indexing:
 * fast Lucene document creation
 * poor IO performance - this will slow down conditional updates, i.e. inserting the Lucene document in the index

With the above we will have a background indexing task(s) which may produce Lucene Documents faster than the indexer can consume them. This will fill up the indexer queue which is also used by user create/update tasks (HTTP requests).  
h3. Steps to Reproduce

TODO
h3. Expected Results

Background indexing tasks should not affect user indexing tasks.
h3. Actual Results

Currently a background indexing task can fill up the indexer queue and user indexing requests will timeout after 30sec:
{noformat}
/secure/CreateIssueDetails.jspa [c.a.j.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Wait attempt timed out - waited 30000 milliseconds
com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException: Wait attempt timed out - waited 30000 milliseconds
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.obtain(DefaultIndexManager.java:872)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.await(DefaultIndexManager.java:843)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.executeWithIndexLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:830)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:618)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssueObjects(DefaultIndexManager.java:494)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndex(DefaultIndexManager.java:540)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndex(DefaultIndexManager.java:523) 
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

In Jira DC:
 * Background indexing should not be used. Always favour foreground indexing on one of the nodes which will not accept any user requests during re-indexing. This will guarantee faster re-indexing and not affecting concurrent user requests.
 * SLA recalculation: the number of recalculation threads should be limited to 1 

In Jira Server:
 * IO performance should be investigated: conditional index updates trigger index flush which performance can be negatively affected by slow disk: [KB: Troubleshooting performance with JIRA Stats | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/troubleshooting-performance-with-jira-stats-1041829254.html]
** Specifically check: Disk performance, _updateDocumentsWithVersionMillis_, _processDBRMessageUpdateWithRelatedIndexInMillis_
 * Background indexing should not be triggered on a regular basis. Since Jira 8.10 the index should be consistent with the DB and there is no need to background indexing to guarantee this.
 * If re-indexing is needed always favour foreground indexing (in Jira Server this  means Jira being not available for users). Note that Jira DC provides HA in case of running foreground indexing.

Note that a slightly slower background indexing time is expected (since Jira 8.10) and this it not the problem described by this issue. This issue is about the problem of background indexing tasks taking over the indexer and affecting all user requests. Explained here: [KB: Background reindex is slow after upgrading to Jira 8.10 and later| https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/background-reindex-is-slow-after-upgrading-to-jira-8-10-and-later-1027126085.html]

Note that the indexer may be flooded by apps triggering re-indexing in non request (user) threads. This may be very similar to running a full foreground re-index (multi-thread) with parallel user requests. In such case the plugin app should not trigger re-indexing on more then one thread. The workaround  should include checking if there is a way of controlling the number of re-indexing threads.
fields.summary: IndexException: Wait attempt timed out - waited 30000 milliseconds caused by background indexing tasks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When configuring a Jira Mail Handler to a GMAIL mailbox, any attachment coming from an incoming email will be stored in the database with an upper case MIME type, causing the attachments to be displayed as plain text in the issue created by email:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira 8.13.0
 # Configure a Mail Server connected to a GMAIL mailbox in *⚙ > Incoming Mail*
 # Configure a Jira Mail Handler connected to the GMAIL Mail server with the type "Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue"
 # Send a new email including a PDF file to the GMAIL Mailbox
 # Wait for the email to be processed and to create a new issue

h3. Expected Results

File attachment should show the "pdf" MIME type and it should be available to preview when clicked.

!O1.png|width=239,height=158!
h3. Actual Results

Observe that the PDF file has the "plain text" MIME type and that it's impossible to preview it
 !G1.png|width=249,height=157!

h3. Notes

(i) This issue is not reproducible when the Jira Mail Handler is connected to an *OUTLOOK mailbox*.
(i) This issue is not reproducible when using a Service Desk Mail Handler (configured in *Service Desk project settings > Email Requests*) instead of a Jira Mail Handler.


h3. Workaround
* Download the PDF file and view from local desktop.
* To fix the problem and to be able to preview the PDF file in Jira UI, we can use the below SQL query.
{code:java}
update fileattachment set mimetype='application/pdf' where issueid=<issue_id_here> and filename='<PDF_FILE_NAME>'; {code}
fields.summary: Jira Mail Handler when configured with GMAIL is not storing the file MIME type correctly in the DB when processing any incoming mail with any type of attachment.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, if you have an Epic Link field in the view screen of a ticket, it will show a colored label with the text inside being white. However, in other screens like in the list view of a filter result or in boards, the text is black.

This lead to confusion sometimes, and the black text is also hard to see when the label color is dark (like brown or blue).

h3. Suggestion
Standardize the white color texts in these colored labels across the whole application in Jira's UI.
fields.summary: Standardize the color of the Epic Link label across Jira's UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

At this moment, the issue count from the project's page is overlapping the menus (Help, Administration, Profile).

(I'm also sending a video recording demonstrating the issue and how to reproduce it.)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access any project that has more than 1 issue created.
 # Go to the *Issues* option.
 # Click on the *Expand* option (besides the issue number count).
 # Click on any of the options (Help, Administration, Profile).

h3. Expected Results

The issue count is hidden behind the menus.
h3. Actual Results

The issue count overlaps the menus.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue count overlapping menus

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Whenever a board is using the simplified workflow, if a Board Administrator is also listed as a Project Administrator, this user will be able to alter the board's *Simplified Workflow*, as described in the *Benefits of using the Simplified Workflow* section of the [Using the Simplified Workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/using-the-simplified-workflow-938845286.html] article: 
{quote}
* Can be edited via the board configuration (see Adding a new status on the Configuring columns page), provided that you are the project administrator for the project that is on the board.
{quote}

However, when the project's permission scheme has been configured to remove the *Extended project administration* permission it is an indicator that the *Jira System Administrators* would like to prevent project administrators from altering the workflow associated with the project. Because of that, it would be nice if the boards where the *Extended project administration* permission has been removed, would not present the *Add status* button enabled by default, allowing *Jira System Administrators* to configure the boards to allow board/project administrators to use this feature provided by the *Simplified Workflow* preventing these users from inadvertently altering the project's workflow.

h3. Workaround

Remove the board administrator role, or change the simplified workflow to the Jira Workflow
fields.summary: Prevent Project Administrators from altering a project’s workflow by default using the Simplified Workflow functionality

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There's no layout for fields in Create Issue screen and all the fields are being listed vertically in a single column. While in Issue View screen (issue details page), the fields are nicely organized.
h3. Suggested Solution

Ability to customize the fields layout in Create Issue screen
fields.summary: Ability to customize layout in Create Issue screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding a new incoming mail server with OAuth 2.0 or editing an existing one, setting the timeout doesn't have any effect. Afterwards the timeout is still 10000 ms.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add or edit an incoming mail server with OAuth 2.0.
# Set the timeout to 12345 ms.
# Click "Authorize".
# Click "Test Connection".
# Click "Save".
# Edit the server and examine the timeout value.

h3. Expected Results
It should show 12345 ms.

h3. Actual Results
It shows 10000 ms which is the default value.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Setting timeout when adding/updating an incoming mail server with OAuth 2.0 doesn't have any effect - timeout is set to default 10000 ms

fields.description: We can not create multiple Custom Field Configurations in Same Project. I think it should be a standard JIRA feature. This way I have to create more identical custom fields with different configurations. It makes a mess.
fields.summary: Can not create multiple Custom Field Configurations in Same Project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using Spanish as JIRA's language, we receive notification with partial information.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Choose Spanish as language in JIRA 
 # Enable Batched Notifications
 # Add more than one comment to a JIRA Software ticket

h3. Expected Results
Notification shows up as the English Notification:

 !image-2021-01-27-15-49-47-113.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Notification shows up without a description of what was done on the ticket:

 !image-2021-01-27-15-50-25-256.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Spanish batch notification doesn't show complete message

fields.description:
Currently, when creating a Copy of a Workflow Scheme, it adds the 'Copy' prefix and places it under the Inactive list as described in [Configuring workflow schemes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-workflow-schemes-938847421.html].
{panel}
Choose *Administration* (  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/files/938846705/951394504/1/1527598488980/cog_icon.png|width=18! ) > *Issues*. Select *Workflow Schemes* to open the Workflow Schemes page.
|Operation|Instructions|
|Copy a workflow scheme|Click the *Copy* link to create a workflow scheme with the prefix "Copy of (name of current workflow)" and placed in the inactive workflow schemes.|
{panel}

h3. Expected Behavior
Since every other copy operation of every other issue component prompts you to choose the new name it would be good to have a Prompt allowing you to select the Workflow Scheme Name.
fields.summary: Prompt to select name when Copying a Workflow Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira currently only supports IMAP for Microsoft when authenticating using OAuth 2.0. Support should also be enabled for POP. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup Microsoft client configurations in the OAuth 2.0 plugin
 # Navigate to "Incoming Mail" in Application properties
 # Select Microsoft and currently, only IMAP is supported
 # Configure mail handler using Microsoft configuration and POP3 protocol

h3. Expected Results

The newly configured mail handler is working properly and can be saved.
h3. Actual Results

An error is being thrown on the "Test connection" step.
h5. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Microsoft POP Support for Emails using OAuth 2.0
